pull.title: Split `CWallet::Create()` into `CreateNew` and `LoadExisting`
pull.body:
This PR is mostly a refactor which splits out logic used for creating wallets and for loading wallets, both of which are presently contained in `CWallet::Create()` into `CWallet::CreateNew()` and `CWallet::LoadExisting()`

The real win of this PR is that `CWallet::Create()` uses a very bad heuristic for trying to guess whether or not it is supposed to be creating a new wallet or loading an existing wallet:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/370c59261269fd9043674e0f4fd782a89e724473/src/wallet/wallet.cpp#L2882-L2885

This heuristic assumes that wallets with no `ScriptPubKeyMans` are being created, which sounds reasonable, but as demonstrated in #32112 and #32111, this can happen when the user tries to load a wallet file that is corrupted, both issues are fixed by this PR and any other misbehavior for wallet files which succeeded the broken heuristic's sniff test for new wallets.

It was already the case that every caller of `CWallet::Create()` knows whether it is creating a wallet or loading one, so we can avoid replacing this bad heuristic with another one, and just shift the burden to the caller.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/32636. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [w0xlt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-3695320394), [achow101](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#issuecomment-3813529036), [murchandamus](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-3741832271) | | Concept ACK | [pablomartin4btc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-2928917813), [rkrux](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-2932150392), [enirox001](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-3235533295) | | Approach ACK | [polespinasa](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#pullrequestreview-3707229445) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34400](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34400) (wallet: parallel fast rescan (approx 5x speed up with 16 threads) by Eunovo) * [#34301](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34301) (wallet: remove outdated `RewriteDB` calls from SPKM & `DBErrors::NEED_REWRITE` enum value by rkrux) * [#34193](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34193) (wallet: make migration more robust against failures by furszy) * [#33034](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33034) (wallet: Store transactions in a separate sqlite table by achow101) * [#32895](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32895) (wallet: Prepare for future upgrades by recording versions of last client to open and decrypt by achow101) * [#32138](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32138) (wallet, rpc: remove settxfee and paytxfee by polespinasa) * [#30343](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30343) (wallet, logging: Replace WalletLogPrintf() with LogInfo() by ryanofsky) * [#29278](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29278) (Wallet: Add `maxfeerate` wallet startup option by ismaelsadeeq) * [#25722](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25722) (refactor: Use util::Result class for wallet loading by ryanofsky) * [#19461](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19461) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-gui -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky) * [#19460](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19460) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-wallet -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky) * [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102) (Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Approach ACK

`PopulateWalletFromDB` inside of `CreateNew` should no longer be necessary.

It'd be nice if the load or create intention could be propagated down to the DB level as well. In `SQLiteDatabase::Open`, we pass the flags `SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE` which does both load and create. I think ideally it would be just `SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE` for loading, and `SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE` for creating to further enforce that we expect a file to already exist for loading, and for no files to exist when creating. Similarly, we could avoid calling `TryCreateDirectories` when loading.
Any reason not to just pass a parameter to CWallet::Create, just to fix the bug in the simplest manner? Refactoring should ideally be separate from fixing.

> Any reason not to just pass a parameter to CWallet::Create, just to fix the bug in the simplest manner? Refactoring should ideally be separate from fixing.

Because doing the bare minimum to fix a bug that is unreachable in production is how we end up with technical debt.

IMO, this PR is primarily a refactor to split these 2 actions that should not be combined. The fact that it fixes those bugs, which are a result of the combining, is a bonus.

Concept ACK

The current state of this code in `master` adds [confusion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32481#discussion_r2147385870) to flows like the legacy to descriptor wallet migration that's why I think it's an important work to be done.

Concept ACK 0f82224d3937db3f60cfaec249ac5fe3264dc3d5
I want to share my initial thoughts before I invest more time reviewing this.

---------
I am in favour of such a refactor because from a reviewing POV I lose mental cycles every time I end up going through `CWallet:Create` function that requires me to keep a mental context of whether this function was called from the creation flow or the load flow. Also, I feel this is a good time to get this done now that legacy wallets are no longer there.

However, I am slightly less inclined to review this PR in its current format because there are a few moving pieces here, and I'm afraid reviewing it thoroughly might be more time consuming and would induce less confidence in me finally a-c-king it. 

Moreover, I feel the benefits of such a refactor would be more highlighted and appreciated if this can be broken down into smaller PRs in addition to ensuring data-correctness. Couple reasons I'm suggesting a breakdown are:
1. I would like to give more attention to each of the commits by trying to understand their consequences on the wallet as a whole.
2. I don't suppose all the commits are required to be present sequentially in a single PR based on my initial look, please feel free to correct me if I'm mistaken about their ability to be present in parallel.

<details open>
<summary>PR breakdown suggestion</summary>

The first 3 can be done in parallel & the last one might be dependent on the previous ones:

1. The `PopulateWalletFromDB` related changes can be 1 PR - the first 2 commits.
3. The `fBroadcastTransactions` change is independent, can be clubbed with the birth-time-update-removal optimisation - 3rd, 6th commits.
4. The argument parsing changes also seem independent to me and can be another PR - 4th, 5th commits.
5. No strong opinion on the wallet stats logging commit, can go anywhere.
6. The last 5 commits can be 1 PR that introduces and uses the `LoadExisting` & `CreateNew` functions.
</details>


Also, I believe [this is a good suggestion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#issuecomment-2920676506) that might give dividends in the future and breaking down into smaller PRs might make it easy to incorporate it.

Having suggested all this, if you think the reward for breaking down the PR is not enough because the smaller refactoring PRs might not attract reviewers or might add rebase churn, I would still review this PR later but some kind of breakdown would aid review if not the one that I suggested.

Sorry if this got too long.

Shouldn't `src/wallet/walletdb.cpp` be part of this PR? `DBErrors WalletBatch::LoadWallet(CWallet* pwallet)` is being called during wallet creation I think. If so, please also consider the **note** at #33082's description.

@achow101 
> `PopulateWalletFromDB` inside of `CreateNew` should no longer be necessary.

@pablomartin4btc 
> DBErrors WalletBatch::LoadWallet(CWallet* pwallet) is being called during wallet creation I think.

Thanks for catching this, fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636/commits/acc0d3b7d4e8b26e1dc5832497b2b47047b6a453

> It'd be nice if the load or create intention could be propagated down to the DB level as well. In `SQLiteDatabase::Open`, we pass the flags `SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE` which does both load and create. I think ideally it would be just `SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE` for loading, and `SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE` for creating to further enforce that we expect a file to already exist for loading, and for no files to exist when creating. Similarly, we could avoid calling `TryCreateDirectories` when loading.

Agreed, I think it might be better to fix this in a follow-up as this PR is already quite large.

----

@rkrux 

> I feel the benefits of such a refactor would be more highlighted and appreciated if this can be broken down into smaller PRs

Thanks for the suggestion, despite the large number of commits in this PR, I've tried my best to make each one atomic and readable. I would prefer to not split into multiple PR's since most of the commits here are refactors that are setting-up for splitting wallet creation and loading, the first PR(s) in the series would have very little motivation, but if you insist I am open to splitting it up. Is there a particular commit or group of commits that are difficult to review?

>  I would prefer to not split into multiple PR's since most of the commits here are refactors that are setting-up for splitting wallet creation and loading, the first PR(s) in the series would have very little motivation, but if you insist I am open to splitting it up.

No insistence at the moment, I will do a full review of the PR soon.

<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->
 At least one of the CI tasks failed.
<sub>Task `TSan, depends, no gui`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/49052123167</sub>
<sub>LLM reason ( experimental): Compilation failed in wallet tests: LoadExisting is called with six arguments, but its declaration only takes five.</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

Concept ACK, overall the refactor is a good attempt, and would modularize the code better. Here are review comments on a commit by commit basis. The commits are self contained and atomic, which I commend, makes review very efficient.

f92031e3b0: Good rename from LoadWallet() to PopulateWalletFromDB() with proper scripted-diff.
8b6a8a04f9: Good separation of error handling logic into PopulateWalletFromDB() with overloaded method for detailed error reporting.
f6c4454b87: Good conversion from if-else to switch statement, adds missing LOAD_FAIL case.
3a29186688: Minor optimization moving -walletbroadcast init outside locked section.
d9a3af962a: Excellent extraction of argument parsing into LoadWalletArgs() method.
347834e41b: Necessary fix moving LoadWalletArgs() before PopulateWalletFromDB() for proper init order.
39503c4667: Good cleanup removing redundant birth time update logic.
cf59f05485: Solid extraction of stats logging into LogStats() method.
29c624ad9e: Well-executed separation creating LoadExisting() method.
7f7dc32765: Completes refactoring by updating callers to use LoadExisting().
dd720fe5bd: Properly updates test infrastructure with separate create/load functions.
62e0721cae: Good extraction of version writing into WriteVersion() method for reusability. 
8ef5c41445: Successfully removes loading logic from Create(), now creation-only.
8022e04ccf: Fixes bug where encrypted wallets showed incorrect keypool size.
a6b43fa173: Good final rename from Create() to CreateNew() for clarity.

Made a few minor observations that might need attention:
Rebased to address a small merge conflict, since some instances of `LoadWallet()` (renamed PopulateWalletFromDB in this branch) were removed in #33082.

Code review b29d22a3d8395865a0a79daf16d44b4eb98f571e

Looks pretty neat to me, the refactor clearly differentiates between the wallet creation & load, and makes it easy to navigate this areas of the codebase. The usage of `PopulateWalletFromDB` function in `LoadExisting` and not in `CreateNew` is also helpful in maintaining the reading flow.
+1 on also fixing the encrypted wallet logging bug.

I believe this refactor is worth checking in the master branch.

events.message:
scripted-diff: refactor: CWallet::LoadWallet->PopulateWalletFromDB

There are too many functions in CWallet with names like "Load" and
"Create", disambiguate what CWallet::LoadWallet does by renaming it to
PopulateWalletFromDB.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's|\bLoadWallet()|PopulateWalletFromDB()|g' $(git grep -l 'LoadWallet()' -- ':(exclude)src/wallet/walletdb.cpp')
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body:
Pushed an update to this branch to address @rkrux's feedback, and feedback from an offline review with @achow101 and @w0xlt.

- I've dropped an unnecessary overloaded version of `PopulateWalletFromDB()` that doesn't take an error and warnings argument, deleting some users of `PopulateWalletFromDB()` and creating dummy variables for another user.
- Significantly improved commit messasge for 1c4f17e.

The PR executes a good refactoring and changes the function names to declare their intent (create vs load) .
The identified issues (`WriteVersion` parameter, public `PopulateWalletFromDB`) are minor and appropriate for follow-up PRs.
The CI error is unrelated.

events.message: refactor: wallet: move error handling to PopulateWalletFromDB()

wallet: refactor: PopulateWalletFromDB use switch statement.

Co-authored-by: @w0xlt <w0xlt@users.noreply.github.com>

refactor: Move -walletbroadcast setting init

Modifying `fBroadcastTransactions` does not require any locks,
initialization of this wallet parameter can be relocated with all of the
other argument parsing in this function.

events.body:
Please excuse the mess I've made...

I've pushed ([a3e24b0..f9de11f](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/a3e24b0c2e2fd2d72980479ce077250430dfe1c8..f9de11f296df24c63d85d103c5e1e464afc9f4f4)) to change one line which is deleting the build-config.h include in `wallettool.cpp` since I drop the last usage of build-config.h in that file, satisfying IWYU linter:

```console
$ git diff a3e24b0 f9de11f
```
```diff
diff --git a/src/wallet/wallettool.cpp b/src/wallet/wallettool.cpp
index b59308bae9..e0de4fc958 100644
--- a/src/wallet/wallettool.cpp
+++ b/src/wallet/wallettool.cpp
@@ -2,8 +2,6 @@
 // Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 // file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.

-#include <bitcoin-build-config.h> // IWYU pragma: keep
-
 #include <wallet/wallettool.h>

 #include <common/args.h>
```
reACK f9de11f296df24c63d85d103c5e1e464afc9f4f4

events.message:
refactor: Split out wallet argument loading

This section is necessarily repetitive, makes CWallet::Create() easier
to read, and splits out functionality that will be useful when wallet
creation and loading are separated.

Review with `-color-moved=dimmed-zebra`

wallet: Move argument parsing to before DB load

`m_keypool_size` must be set before `CWallet::PopulateWalletFromDB()`,
in order to move parsing of `-keypool` into `CWallet::LoadWalletArgs`,
`LoadWalletArgs()` invocation in `CWallet::Create()` must be moved
before `PopulateWalletFromDB()` is called.

wallet: Remove redundant birth time update

Checking every SPKM in `CWallet::Create()` is not necessary, since the
only way presently for an SPKM to get added to `m_spk_managers` (the
return value of `GetAllScriptPubKeyMans()`) is through
`AddScriptPubKeyMan()`, which already invokes `MaybeUpdateBirthTime()`.

refactor: Wallet stats logging in its own function

This will avoid repetition when wallet creation and loading are
separated.

wallet: Create separate function for wallet load

Splits out logic relevant only to existing wallets in
`CWallet::Create()` into `CWallet::LoadExisting()`
wallet: Use CWallet::LoadExisting() for loading existing wallets.
test: wallet: Split create and load

refactor: wallet: Factor out `WriteVersion()` from `PopulateWalletFromDB()`

Writing the wallet's `CLIENT_VERSION` (which indicates the last version
to have touched a wallet) needs to be done on both wallet creation and
wallet loading.

The next commit removes the `PopulateWalletFromDatabase()` call from
wallet creation, but this behavior needs to be preserved, so this commit
factors setting `CLIENT_VERSION` out of `PopulateWalletFromDatabase()`
so that wallet creation can use it in the next commit.
wallet: remove loading logic from CWallet::Create

wallet: Correctly log stats for encrypted messages.

Previously creating an encrypted wallet would result in the keypool size
incorrectly being reported as 0.

See: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#discussion_r2150021064

scripted-diff: refactor: CWallet::Create() -> CreateNew()

Aside from being more legible, changing the name of `CWallet::Create()`
also validates that every instance where a new wallet is `Create()`'ed
is handled in this branch.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's|\bCreate(|CreateNew(|g' src/wallet/wallet.cpp  src/wallet/wallet.h  src/wallet/test/util.cpp src/wallet/test/wallet_tests.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body:
([`git range-diff f9de11f...db2effa`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/f9de11f296df24c63d85d103c5e1e464afc9f4f4..db2effaca4cf82bf806596d16f9797d3692e2da7)) Pushed to address @achow101's feedback:

- Fix the bug in fallback fee behavior in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/097e00f90765915b0f8353a4eb5ebb18ceae2a66 (see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#discussion_r2706102550 and #34382)
- Drop `create_flags` from `TestLoadWallet()`
- Add `options.require_create = true` to `TestCreateWallet()` to enforce wallet creation.
- Add `options.require_existing = true` to `TestLoadWallet()` to enforce wallet loading.
reACK db2effaca4cf82bf806596d16f9797d3692e2da7

approach ACK db2effaca4cf82bf806596d16f9797d3692e2da7

As a contributor not really familiar with the wallet codebase this PR makes the difference when understanding the code.
Having the creating and loading logic separated makes much sense.

I reviewed all commits, they look clean and neat :) 
I just don't understand why b4a49cc7275efc16d4a4179ed34b50de5bb7367e and b15a94a618c53041e97ccfface3045a0642777e1 are on different commits, they look pretty related to me.

I don't have comments regarding the code, so far lgtm.
ACK db2effaca4cf82bf806596d16f9797d3692e2da7
Review comments up to ae66e01"wallet: Create separate function for wallet load"

Thanks for the good structure of the PR that was easy to follow. Im fairly new to looking at the wallet creation and loading logic, so I just a have a few nits that you can feel free to ignore unless you need to touch the code again. The changes look like a good improvement to me.

ACK db2effaca4cf82bf806596d16f9797d3692e2da7

comments.body:
In 744ebdc18556223b8749a7fed420c9ae95be418e:

Sometime back I noted that during the creation of encrypted wallets, the wallet metrics are not correctly logged after the SPKMs have been created. This is unlike the creation of non-encrypted wallets where the correct metrics are logged because they are done so after the setup of SPKMS. PFB a sample from my node.

```bash
^[[C=2025-05-27T15:19:21Z Using SQLite Version 3.43.2
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z Using wallet /Users/rkrux/Library/ApplicationSupport/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets/encryptedtest
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z init message: Loading wallet
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] Legacy Wallet Keys: 0 plaintext, 0 encrypted, 0 w/ metadata, 0 total.
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] Descriptors: 0, Descriptor Keys: 0 plaintext, 0 encrypted, 0 total.
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] Setting minversion to 169900
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] Wallet completed loading in              12ms
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] setKeyPool.size() = 0
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] mapWallet.size() = 0
2025-05-27T15:19:21Z [encryptedtest] m_address_book.size() = 0
2025-05-27T15:19:22Z [encryptedtest] Encrypting Wallet with an nDeriveIterations of 251048
2025-05-27T15:19:22Z [encryptedtest] Setting spkMan to active: id = a8af620b202a2542a6b4575578133499397089fa67110b27dffced31b3e6ccbd, type = legacy, internal = false
2025-05-27T15:19:22Z [encryptedtest] Setting spkMan to active: id = b389c6313cd85b907990fd2c57a87db230fa0dad1c94c929dd0e010e036d802e, type = p2sh-segwit, internal = false
2025-05-27T15:19:22Z [encryptedtest] Setting spkMan to active: id = 727d3e57942f107c713932ccf8aec8f6968ee76b98f8787802afc62cbaa13d38, type = bech32, internal = false
```

I was not sure if a PR just for this would garner review but now that the code touching these metrics is being updated anyway, might as well fix this issue. I have not checked if this PR already fixes it, great if it does!

> The real win of this PR is that CWallet::Create() uses a very bad heuristic for trying to guess whether or not it is supposed to be creating a new wallet or loading an existing wallet

Agree that this is not a good heuristic but the PR description doesn't seem to explain or summarise why it's a bad heuristic. Maybe add few points from the findings of the linked issues?

In f26bf5fd24ffed501dfdb3528c56cfaee0203a72 "scripted-diff: refactor: rename CWallet::LoadWallet"

I think we could actually drop the `PopulateWalletFromDB` here and in other test setups that call it immediately after some kind of `Create*WalletDatabase()` since there's nothing in the databases anyways to load. These calls should be no-ops.

We have the assert above so we don't need to check if it's a descriptor and legacy can't be created anymore.
```suggestion
            walletInstance->SetupDescriptorScriptPubKeyMans();
```
Please consider #32977
This is done in #33082: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33082/commits/30c6f64eed304560464f9601b80c811c186db20a
Nice find, sorry I missed this.
This was fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32481/commits/5431f2dc2159f55e0fbe89d07deb97fe2a73fb43 (nice!), fixed on this branch by rebasing.
Thanks for pointing this out, I've updated the PR description to address this.
Thanks for pointing this out, I've fixed this issue in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636/commits/9de86da65e3dffb8e9c3dbd9771258f0924db798.
Thanks for the suggestion, fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636/commits/da4579d97863924272eab2246c45a0802b226cf8.

In 4c6890cdae77ca0d230227530b000f4b3c6fd77a "wallet: Create separate function for wallet load"

When loading, `wallet_creation_flags` is unnecessary. Flags cannot be updated when loading a wallet, and having a specific warning for `WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS` seems entirely unnecessary.
Is the the check for the presence of private keys in a wallet where `WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS` is set also unnecessary?
Fixed the suggestion as I understood it, thanks for catching this.
Thanks for catching this, fixed.

The current error handling only checks for `LOAD_OK` and ignores the error string provided by the new overload. This may result in losing useful error details. It might be worth updating the handling to make use of the message
In 8b6a8a0  it seems the `WriteVersion` method uses  `CLIENT_VERSION` instead of the `client_version` parameter
This is out of scope, but I can address this in a follow-up.
This PR does not change the error handling here, but I can address this in a follow-up.

In 835de2490ed925da8df77815e8e1a6457bf1dc1e "refactor: wallet: Add `WriteVersion()`"

> Writing the wallet version needs to be done on wallet creation, but
WalletBatch::LoadWallet() does not, so factor this functionality out.

Note for the commit message: I had a tough time trying to parse this text and don't fully understand what it's supposed to say. As per code, ISTM that the wallet version is written unconditionally on creation and conditionally on load.

In 79adf2163138cd1e30637904243945f191dc721d "scripted-diff: refactor: rename CWallet::LoadWallet"

`PopulateWalletFromDB` is a public function of class `CWallet` that is called by the outside modules such as tests and wallet-tool besides the static function `CWallet::LoadExisting`. As a reader going through these call sites does make me wonder for a bit what this function would be doing differently from the usual `Load` function, even though the name is quite self-explanatory to a large extent.

Maybe add some documentation here for explicitness mentioning that this function has barebones functionality so that the caller has the right expectations?

Thanks for pointing this out, some of those calls to PopulateWalletFromDB() are spurious / should be using the existing loading functions, I've pushed an update that deletes some of the calls to `PopulateWalletFromDB()` but I think it will take a follow-up in order to make it private, which I think is a better design, this seems like an internal function.
Thank you, fixed.

Sorry, thanks for catching this, really not sure what I was thinking when I wrote that commit message, think it may have been an earlier version of the branch. Now reads:

```
refactor: wallet: Factor out `WriteVersion()` from `PopulateWalletFromDB()`

Writing the wallet's `CLIENT_VERSION` (which indicates the last version
to have touched a wallet) needs to be done on both wallet creation and
wallet loading.

The next commit removes the `PopulateWalletFromDatabase()` call from
wallet creation, but this behavior needs to be preserved, so this commit
factors setting `CLIENT_VERSION` out of `PopulateWalletFromDatabase()`
so that wallet creation can use it in the next commit.
```

In 097e00f90765915b0f8353a4eb5ebb18ceae2a66 "refactor: Split out wallet argument loading"

I believe this is a change in behavior.

Previously, if `-fallbackfee` is not specified, the default value of `0` would be used, which this line would then disable the fallback fee. However, moving this to require the check for `-fallbackfee` should result in the default of `m_allow_fallback_fee = true`, even when the default value of `0` is being used.

In e655683ec984a73ff198ecb4a8df0d5c5b0f1f98 "test: wallet: Split create and load"

`create_flags` is now unused.

In e655683ec984a73ff198ecb4a8df0d5c5b0f1f98 "test: wallet: Split create and load"

Should add a `options.require_create = true` so that `MakeWalletDatabase` can enforce that the database is being created.

In e655683ec984a73ff198ecb4a8df0d5c5b0f1f98 "test: wallet: Split create and load"

This is no longer necessary

In e655683ec984a73ff198ecb4a8df0d5c5b0f1f98 "test: wallet: Split create and load"

Should add `options.require_existing = true` so that `MakeWalletDatabase` can enforce that the database already exists.
Will do, maybe in a follow-up it could be enforced that the presence of `create_flags` requires that a wallet is being created and `require_create` can be dropped.
Opened https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34382/ to add a test that would have caught this.
Thanks for catching this, I've pushed an update that fixes.
Thanks, done.
Fixed.
Good idea, fixed.
Fixed, thanks.
nit: Maybe b4a49cc7275efc16d4a4179ed34b50de5bb7367e and b15a94a618c53041e97ccfface3045a0642777e1 can be squashed?
I avoided squashing these two because https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/b4a49cc7275efc16d4a4179ed34b50de5bb7367e is not strictly a refactor
Nit: the `PopulateWalletFromDB` method is undocumented.

In wallet: Delete unnecessary PopulateWalletFromDB() calls (0972785fd723b9b3c84844bf999d6e08e163ef9d):
Nit: It would be better if the commit message had a concise explanation why those calls were unnecessary.

In "wallet: refactor: PopulateWalletFromDB use switch statement." (411caf72815bdf2e176e790a4c63f745517c4bb4):
Nit: I was wondering whether refactoring to a switch-case was just stylistic preference, but I take it that this was done to make the compiler catch missing cases. If thats the motivation it might be nice to include that in the commit message.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -873,9 +873,12 @@ class CWallet final : public WalletStorage, public interfaces::Chain::Notificati
 
     static bool LoadWalletArgs(std::shared_ptr<CWallet> wallet, const WalletContext& context, bilingual_str& error, std::vector<bilingual_str>& warnings);
 
-    /* Initializes the wallet, returns a new CWallet instance or a null pointer in case of an error */
+    /* Initializes, creates and returns a new CWallet; returns a null pointer in case of an error */
comments.body:
In "wallet: Create separate function for wallet load" (ae66e011646266abb67b31027bc29e0ce1d08ad4):
Micro-Nit: The order here seems odd. Wouldnt it be:
```suggestion
    /* Creates, initializes, and returns a new CWallet; returns a null pointer in case of an error */
```

Or am I misunderstanding what initialize means here?

In "wallet: Create separate function for wallet load" (ae66e01):
(Cont.) The appearance of Initializes here confuses me. It seems to refer to a part of loading the wallet as the term otherwise only appears in `postInitProcess` which is called in `LoadWalletInternal` and `CreateWallet` after the wallet has been loaded, whereas in the context of CreateWallet I interpret it as setting the wallet flags and topping up the key pool of a new wallet (see: `// Init with passed flags.`).

In "wallet: Use CWallet::LoadExisting() for loading existing wallets." (70dbc79b09acf7b1515532ee20c7533c938ffb70):
Nit: Kinda surprised about the comment being `// Make the local wallet` and then `LoadExisting` being called here. Especially, when we seem to be creating one from a database. Maybe the comment here could be improved, when its being touched anyway.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -873,9 +873,12 @@ class CWallet final : public WalletStorage, public interfaces::Chain::Notificati
 
     static bool LoadWalletArgs(std::shared_ptr<CWallet> wallet, const WalletContext& context, bilingual_str& error, std::vector<bilingual_str>& warnings);
 
-    /* Initializes the wallet, returns a new CWallet instance or a null pointer in case of an error */
+    /* Initializes, creates and returns a new CWallet; returns a null pointer in case of an error */
comments.body: "Initialize" here is synonymous with "create", so this wording is a bit redundant.
"make" in this context means "create the CWallet object that lives in memory", not actually making a wallet on disk.

This was suggested by a reviewer above: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#discussion_r2229614994

I think it's mostly a stylistic choice, but it does have the nice benefit of enforcing that we handle all cases, if I retouch I'll mention this in the commit message.

Good point, the reason these are not necessary is because we have just created a mock database, so there are no records to populate the wallet object from. I assume that the reason they were originally added had something to do with legacy behavior, but I don't think it does anything now to call `PopulateWalletFromDB()` with a `MockableDatabase` since it is initialized with an empty set of records:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c7cf2b8f3aae122a0b7acb8f8d9cb0e2ad94c49f/src/wallet/test/util.h#L102

and `PopulateWalletFromDB() afaict only reads records, except in the instances where it performs some migration of old or malformed wallet data:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c7cf2b8f3aae122a0b7acb8f8d9cb0e2ad94c49f/src/wallet/walletdb.cpp#L1177-L1190

If I retouch I will add more context to this commit message.
Thanks for catching this, I've fixed this in a follow-up: #34490 (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34490/commits/dcc8bd227db84d1addfe3bebfc7897623070280f)

     static bool LoadWalletArgs(std::shared_ptr<CWallet> wallet, const WalletContext& context, bilingual_str& error, std::vector<bilingual_str>& warnings);
 
-    /* Initializes the wallet, returns a new CWallet instance or a null pointer in case of an error */

comments.body:
Responding to the review comment [below](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#discussion_r2229614994) here: 

What I wanted to express was that both functions, `CreateNew()` and `LoadExisting()` "initialize" a `CWallet` object, which was previously what was meant by `Create()` in `CWallet::Create()`, even though it both loaded and "created" new wallets, it always "created" a `CWallet` object.

I've improved both function descriptions in a follow-up pr #34490: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34490/commits/dcc8bd227db84d1addfe3bebfc7897623070280f to avoid making ACK's stale.
Discussion above: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32636#discussion_r2757355261
I've added a commit to fix this in follow-up: #34490 (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34490/changes/2f4e60533d4f4ba537ba54231d276a6c6290914a)
